result.execSummary:
The defendant Jabar Taylor Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: concurrent to Count 2 and consecutive to 22CM922.

Court recommends the Mental Health Unit of the probation department.
Case is adjourned to 11-18-2022 at 1:30 pm for a Probation Review Hearing.

miscConds.notes: Case is adjourned to 9-30-2022 at 8:30 am for a Restitution Hearing.

Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent.
No contact with D.L.G. and S.D.G.

Mental health evaluation and cooperate with any treatment deemed necessary by the probation department.
Complete Batterer's Intervention Program.

timeConds.notes: STAYED to be reviewed at the Probation Review Hearing date.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: concurrent to Count 1 and consecutive to 22CM922.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jabar Taylor Sr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jabar Taylor Sr not in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Jabar Taylor Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a restitution hearing.  Victim D.J. appears by zoom and informs the court she is not asking for any restitution.  Court sets restitution at 0.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/ Wavier of Rights, filed.

Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court, defendant Jabar Taylor not in court, in custody.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Jury trial is scheduled for 8-10-22 at 8:30 am.  Defense is requesting a plea and sentecing hearing date.  Case is adjourned to 8-1-22 at 10:30 am for plea and sentencing in person in Room 504 of the Courthouse.  Jury trial date will remain on the Court's calendar until the plea is entered.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court, defendant Jabar Taylor not in court, in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jabar Taylor in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jabar Taylor appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Court will accept transfer of defendant's other cases for global resolution.  Defense counsel needs offer and discovery.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court, defendant Jabar Taylor not in court, in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for bail/bond hearing. Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court DENIES defense's motion to modify bail. Case adjourned to Branch 10.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with D.L.G. and S.D.G.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jabar Taylor in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Jabar Taylor in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jabar Taylor appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
